intro: Lasiocephalus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian hairhead, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
